1. You are the first son of the 1st Assamese among us, and you are the brother of the 2nd and 3rd Assamese among us, and because of the love and affection we have for you, and because of the love we have for you, we consider it a reward to give you some fixed property For the purpose of free of charge, the immovable property entered in paragraph 3 below is transferred to the husband of the 1st respondent, the 2nd and 3rd respondents and your father, Polarauthu Nookinayudu, by way of inheritance, for which a tax receipt has been issued by the Municipality bearing Doru No. 1-35, Assessment No. 1137003647, and since the said Polarauthu Nookinayudu has died, we, the main heirs, have been issued a tax receipt by the Mandal Tahsildar No. As per the Family Member Certificate No. FMC251201035139, the right to the property has been acquired, and since the date of acquisition, the right of possession has been in our possession, and no mortgages, etc. have been made to anyone else, and the market value of the property is Rs. 7,20,000/- (Seven lakh twenty thousand rupees in words) and we hereby consider it as a reward for our love for you, and by virtue of this settlement document, we have transferred the right to you free of charge and have taken possession of the said property immediately. From now on, you shall take possession of the property, register your name in the accounts of the government, pay taxes, etc., and enjoy the rights of all the estates of your sons and grandsons, with the right to sell, borrow, and donate, in a happy and free manner. Whatever disputes may arise regarding this property, whether at any time or by anyone, we will completely settle them on our own responsibility and will continue to execute this property for you without interruption. 1) Polarouthu Nookalamma Visha

This property is not an assignment property as per the Andhra Pradesh Assigned Lands Act 2/1977.
We hereby declare that the property as registered in this settlement deed does not contain any mango, coconut, betel, sweet potato etc. trees, gardens, precious minerals, mines, granite etc. stone quarries, machinery, fish ponds etc. and we agree to take legal action against me and be liable for payment of appropriate duty if any such factual details are found to be concealed in this deed in the future. Declaration:- New Section - 22-B (Central Act 16 of 1908) Wide Andhra Pradesh Ordinance
No.7 of 2016 dated 03-12-2016 We hereby declare that no one else has any right to the property acquired by us by way of inheritance as per this settlement deed and that no sale, purchase or transaction has been made by us to anyone else till now and that no alienation has been committed.
In the course of preparing this document, we have thoroughly examined all the necessary elements such as the deed link documents, collateral / burden confirmations, addresses of the parties, photographs of the parties, property details, etc. and have incorporated them in this document. We have physically inspected the Scheduled Property and taken measurements and have drawn up the document. We will be fully responsible for any discrepancies in the above mentioned matters in the future. 1) Polarauthu Nukalamma Nishani
2) Pola Retu Racharu
3) P. RamanaΠ

1. You are the first son of the 1st Assamese among us, and you are the brother of the 2nd and 3rd Assamese among us, and because of the love and affection we have for you, and because of the love we have for you, we consider it a reward to give you some fixed property For the purpose of free of charge, the immovable property entered in paragraph 3 below is transferred to the husband of the 1st respondent, the 2nd and 3rd respondents and your father, Polarauthu Nookinayudu, by way of inheritance, for which a tax receipt has been issued by the Municipality bearing Doru No. 1-35, Assessment No. 1137003647, and since the said Polarauthu Nookinayudu has died, we, the main heirs, have been issued a tax receipt by the Mandal Tahsildar No. As per the Family Member Certificate No. FMC251201035139, the right to the property has been acquired, and since the date of acquisition, the right of possession has been in our possession, and no mortgages, etc. have been made to anyone else, and the market value of the property is Rs. 7,20,000/- (Seven lakh twenty thousand rupees in words) and we hereby consider it as a reward for our love for you, and by virtue of this settlement document, we have transferred the right to you free of charge and have taken possession of the said property immediately. From now on, you shall take possession of the property, register your name in the accounts of the government, pay taxes, etc., and enjoy the rights of all the estates of your sons and grandsons, with the right to sell, borrow, and donate, in a happy and free manner. Whatever disputes may arise regarding this property, whether at any time or by anyone, we will completely settle them on our own responsibility and will continue to execute this property for you without interruption. 1) Polarouthu Nookalamma Visha

This property is not an assignment property as per the Andhra Pradesh Assigned Lands Act 2/1977.
We hereby declare that the property as registered in this settlement deed does not contain any mango, coconut, betel, sweet potato etc. trees, gardens, precious minerals, mines, granite etc. stone quarries, machinery, fish ponds etc. and we agree to take legal action against me and be liable for payment of appropriate duty if any such factual details are found to be concealed in this deed in the future. Declaration:- New Section - 22-B (Central Act 16 of 1908) Wide Andhra Pradesh Ordinance
No.7 of 2016 dated 03-12-2016 We hereby declare that no one else has any right to the property acquired by us by way of inheritance as per this settlement deed and that no sale, purchase or transaction has been made by us to anyone else till now and that no alienation has been committed.
In the course of preparing this document, we have thoroughly examined all the necessary elements such as the deed link documents, collateral / burden confirmations, addresses of the parties, photographs of the parties, property details, etc. and have incorporated them in this document. We have physically inspected the Scheduled Property and taken measurements and have drawn up the document. We will be fully responsible for any discrepancies in the above mentioned matters in the future. 1) Polarauthu Nukalamma Nishani

sections.content: The property covered under Gift Settlement Deed No 334 of 2026 dated 24/Jan/2026, executed by 1. Polarouthu Nookalamma 2. Polarouthu Rambabu. 3.Polarouthu Ramana in favour of Polarouthu Nageshwararao Whereas Donee is Son of First Donor & Brother of 2,3 Donors , towards the property admeasuring an extent of 61.33Sq.Yds, bearing House number 1-35,Block No.22 vide Assessment No.1137003647, comprised in survey number 91-1 situated in Kokkirapalli village, within the District of Anakapalli registered at sub-registrar office Yelamanchali(310) is bounded as follows: North by: Rahadari South by: Vacant land of Korukonda Lakshmi East by: Common wall of Polaraoutu Rambabu West by: Vacant land of Shanapati Nookaraju *Schedule property is part of Gramakantam as per recitals of the deed*.
It is noted from the given documents and EC that the schedule property is not part of any active Mortgage or Lease Deed.

Note:: It is to be noted that the online EC has been verified using the key parameters, namely the Document Number, Survey Number/House Number, and Split Survey/House Number of the concerned SRO, as per the Deed. However, cross-verification across multiple SROs has not been carried out due to the AP portal’s requirement of separate passwords for each search parameter, and the OTP-based authentication mechanism makes searches across multiple SROs operationally infeasible.
